summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 9863, entitled "An Ordinance relating to the business of stock exchange, or any business of a similar character, conducted for the registration of bets or wagers on the rise or fall of the prices of stocks, grains, oils, or any mercantile article, and also where bets or wagers are made or registered upon the results of horse races, and providing for the punishment of any violation of this ordinance," approved July 7, 1903.
